reviews.sentence: Unwanted intrusion. A hotel maintenance man barged into my room after giving a few door knocks. I was in a state of near nudity when he barged in. The man was supposedly looking for something to fix. I am not convinced I was not being spied on by hotel security. This type of incident has never happened to be before at any hotel. Other than a perverted maintenance man the place was excellent.

Great hotel for people with allergies. I attended a conference at the Hilton Rosemont Airport Hotel. This was not really the Hilton Airport Hotel which was across the street from the United Terminal. It was a shuttle bus ride away. The shuttle terminal was about a block away from the terminal. It was very confusing to find the shuttle terminal building. There are no clear directions. When you find the terminal you have to wait at shuttle stop number 3. The bus runs every 20 minutes during peak hours to this and another hotel. The hotel is close to the convention center but nothing was going on there. The discount shopping mall is a 20 minute walk away but it was very cold outside and my time was limited. There is nothing else in the area I could find out about for entertainment. The hotel was notified by the travel agent of my allergies in advance and they had pre arranged a room for me. The duvet was replaced by a blanket and the pillows were feather free. I was delighted. It is rare to find this degree of care and efficiency by housekeeping. The mattress was nice and firm and I slept very well. The meeting facilities were good. The meeting food was okay. The chicken was moist but the food did not have that much flavor. The Liberty bar and restaurant in the lobby had an excellent tender grilled octopus appetizer. The fig and prosciutto pizza was good. The wine list was good. I do n’t like oak fermented wines and I hate chardonnay. There was a nice New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc on the menu. There is no concierge for the hotel and the front desk is always busy. I did not get by requested wakeup call but luckily I was still able to catch my plane after I dressed and packed in 5 minutes of panic. I wanted to take a swim at my lunch hour and I went up to the 10th floor to use the pool. The housekeeping staff that helped me the night before were alone in the pool having a romantic time. I did not want to spoil the moment for them so I left. The hotel is in good repair. The staff is courteous. This is a good hotel for a conference.

A better Hilton. I have stayed at several Hiltons over the last couple months and this was by far the nicest. Rooms where clean and updated. The air conditioning units were quiet and worked well. Staff was friendly and courteous. The free shuttle to and from the airport was very nice as well. I will stay here again.

Close enough to the airport. What a Hidden gem. Hotel has been renovated and rooms are fresh and clean. Fabulous restaurant onsite amazing menu. Friendly shuttle staff very accommodating. Ample self parking a rarity in an airport location. This airport hotel is full of surprises Burata Salad a must Steak Sandwich is delicious. Onion rings are amazing with a very delicious aioli try and ask for Keneth. He is very knowledgeable and very accommodating. I was here during my birthday and was so glad that I was able to have such a nice dinner.

HIlton Rosemont. Beautiful lobby with full service bar and a Starbucks Store not a kiosk. Excellent food in the restaurant. Rooms very clean and updated. Shuttle runs every twenty minutes to nearby Entertainment District and to the Airport.

Great Location. I visited here for a conference. Hotel has recently been modernised and to a good standard at that. The breakfast selection is not what I expected for America and definitely not worth a visit eat elsewhereThe bar is ok. Swimming pool on the top floor is not a wow factor. Gym is sufficient for a few days stay. Staff are ok. could with some training on how to smile.

Quite solid a little dated but being addressed. Airport Hotels are tough by their nature. This one being both an airport AND convention center hotel has an even tougher road to hoe. They do it reasonably well and I had stay here again. Parking is either surface or in a VERY large garage that is shared with the Embassy Suites and the convention center. The Hilton has reserved spots and the facility is connected to the hotel via SkyBridge. Nice touch during the cold winter months. Worth noting. the SkyBridge is on a separate elevator from the guest rooms. I like this it is an added security measure. Rooms are good clean and in good working order. Shower was strong. Bed was the updated Hilton bedding and comfortable. HVAC is a little wonky do not pay attention to the thermostat numbers just set as warm or as cold as it takes to get the engine moving. Pool is above the 10th floor and has great views. Fitness Room is split in two. Not tremendously good SPACE but the equipment is new and works well. Starbucks in the lobby is a full service Starbucks not a light version. Great staff there and very accommodating. Overall quite solid. and it is right off the highway so it is easy to access 19090. 94294 all RIGHT there.

Great hotel except. I would have given it 5 stars but there was one major problem. First off the staff everyone was super friendly and the entire grounds were clean and updated. My one problem was at the pool. The tile around the pool was super slick when wet. It was extremely unsafe. My husband almost fell in the pool. This is a law suit waiting to happen.

Got it for a very low price on a deal through price line. The hotel was decent for the price I had paid. However if I paid anything over 90 night which many people do for their stay I would have given it 1 star. They charge 26 a day for their garage parking lot. Third party websites list it as free parking and when I asked about the same the hotel management and the third party website blamed each other for the mistake. Even lots in Downtown are cheaper than that. Make it a reasonable 10 12 day parking lot. The rooms are great and maintenance was neat. When I booked I was looking at a lively place because of the proximity to the convention center location. To my surprise I hardly met 5 people during my 2 night stay. Ideal for airport commuters and Convention kinda people.

Pick a room away from the elevator. This is a lovely hotel. Newly renovated spotlessly clean convenient to the airport with reliable shuttle service. My only issue with this hotel was that the elevator makes a fair bit of noise. Probably something you could get used to eventually. but it kept me awake. Since it is so easy to choose your room via the Hilton Honors ap I had recommend choosing a room as far from the elevators as possible.

Great hotel close to the airport. I love our experience. Their pool was being repaired but they send us to the neighbor hotel Embassy which is pretty much connected. The restaurant was really good. I am vegan and they were nice to accommodate my requests. Their quinoa salad is great. They also have a shuttle to the airport and to take you to a 3 mile range.
Overall it was good. Pizza was excellent. We had no microwave or refrigerator in our room and the pool was down due to maintenance.

Over priced. My husband and I stayed here two nights because it was across the street from the convention center and available for our dates. The parking garage is29 per night and is self only no valet. And also shared with another hotel. Had problems finding somewhere to park in the correct hotels spot. When I took a shower in the morning the water in the shower never got hot not even Luke warm. We told the front desk about that night they sent someone to room right away. The maintenance guy said that the hotel was Sold out and there were probably about a lot of people taking a shower at the same time. Really. do not they build hotels to sustain under maximum capacity.

Overpriced. There is any immensity you would like here. The rooms look very old and outdated even though they were remodeled five years ago. It is definitely not current. I had several problems with my television. The HVAC system was old and was constantly cold. I could not get my room to warm up. Overall for the price it is extremely overpriced and not worth the value.

Need to stay at an airport hotel but do not want to feel like you are at an airport hotel. Stay here. The Hilton Rosemont will pick you up directly at the airport the shuttle comes about every 20 minutes so you never wait too long. The shuttle drops you off at the hotel and while only a mile or two away you feel transported to a different area far away from the dreaded airport chaos. The streets around this hotel are totally walkable at any time of day. I walked them alone during the day and at night 10 pm just to test them out. There are tons of highly rated restaurants within a half mile radius and do not even get me started about how great the Fashion Outlet stores are. there is also a conference center very close by maybe a 3 5 minute walk and a significant amount of higher end hotel chains in the area. Check in at this hotel is a breeze. The put me on a top floor and bonus away from elevators and exit stairwells. The room has a bit of a unique setup with a diagonal hall entryway. Once inside the room itself is nice with mostly updated furniture. The room had more than enough outlets score and a self adjustable temperature down to the low 60s. The room was clean and it was easy to see that house keeping pays attention to detail. Also for an airport hotel my room was much larger and much more cozy than expected. The bathroom again was mostly updated with a few older touches like a magnified mirror that was supposed to light up but did not. The water pressure was ok not great and the water temp did not get quite warm enough for my liking. Minor details. The bed was super comfy and I enjoyed a lovely night sleep. Despite being so close to the airport I never heard a single plane which shocked me. The gym is split into two rooms with the cardio machines in one room and weights in another. You need your key to go from one room to the other so be prepared. Both gym rooms were hot. However I was able to adjust the temp on my own without needing to call for help. The gym was not busy and in the hour I spent there I only saw one other person. I did come at what I would consider an off time about 430 pm on a Sunday. I am not sure what it is like first thing in the morning. The gyms along with the small indoor pool are located on the tenth floor. Take note of this since there are not a lot of signs and I walked around trying to find the location for a bit. This hotel has a great conference space and is ideal for your next meeting. I did not love the conference food but that might just be me. I was more than impressed with my stay here and loved that I was only a 10minute drive to the airport. As someone who travels somewhat often I am putting the Hilton Rosemont on my list of hotels I would absolutely revisit.

During my three day stay housekeeping only stopped by once and that was the last day of my stay. The previous days I had mentioned to the front desk for The room to be made up. I was told they would get to it the next day. The same ocured on day 1 when I reported the dresser drawer broken and hanging. It was n’t Repaired the last day of my stay. I expected more from a Hilton hotel.

Terrible Service. HVAC in room did not work. Told the front desk they told me the system was disabled. No repair or offer to move to a different room. Room was an oven during the day and ice cold at night. Left early over it. Would not recommend this property to anyone.

The walkway to the convention center was a blessing and a curse great we were n’t outside in the cold but there has to be something wrong with the thermostat as it was close to 90 degrees in there. I would have maintenance look at it and turn it way down.
Parking is the worst. The entire building needs updating and is over priced. Definitely will inform the group I am here with this location was a BAD decision. My thoughts.
Enjoyed our stay. Wish the rooms were a little more updated.
